Posted By: bowlofgumbo (11/13/2011 6:24:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.  
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.   
  
I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal) is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)
posts.html:

I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a Lotus Petal is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)

posts.post_content:
The authentic masterpiece. [Accept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=48189) [no](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=114904) [imitations](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=4593). :)  
  
In one of my first games of Magic with my partner (on an early date), I demonstrated the Black Lotus + Fastbond + Taiga + Fireball kill. I've had two tournament-playable Lotuses since forever; my partner gave me a third for our one-year-dating anniversary (the awesomely gigantic oversized cardboard one) -- along with a Fastbond print which she found goodness knows where -- and along with a note that read, "A single spark of passion can ignite love's lasting flame -- you had me at turn one." Easily the best awwwww moment of my life. Better even than any engagement ring I could have received (though I want my wedding ring to resemble that awesome-looking new [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=247533) they just printed for EDH/Commander). In fact, we'll be printing the first part on our wedding invitatio... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Best card ever printed and heres why: with this and three[Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s in ur opening hand, you can have [Nullstone Gargoyle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nullstone Gargoyle),[Spirit of the Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit of the Night), [Hand of Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hand of Emrakul),[Artisan of Kozilek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Artisan of Kozilek),or a [Demon of Death's Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demon of Death's Gate) on turn one, and those are just 9 drop creatures. think of all the other combos for 9 mana on ur opening hand. i just listed bad ways to use it, too.

Posted By: Progle (8/9/2011 4:34:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What I love about this card is how it works as a test. If your a noob (and we have all been there) you think it sucks. If your good or experienced, you think it is completely broken. Black Lotus is hands down the best card in the game. It is a crime that this thing is not 5 stars. It is (as someone else said) the Holy Grail of **Magic**.  
  
Some may argue that other members of the Power 9 and other good cards are the best. Mainly, [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall) and [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk). While these cards break the game in half as well, they can't be put into any deck the way that the Black Lotus can. Technically, you can but they wont be good if your playing non-blue. Black Lotus improves any deck.  
  
Some of the people who rate this down are upset about the massive price tag and how the they can't be competitive in Vintage without it. If you don't want to pay thousands of dollars on cards, go play Legacy. Its banned there, I believe (I'm not a tournament player) so jus... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
